intro: Laseguea acutifolia, commonly known as the sharp-leaved laseguea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
